answers.answer: Hello!This can be due to nerve compression due to past injury or ankle twist or due to past fractures. I would also sugggest you to monitor your blood pressure and rule out deep vein thrombosis and other peripheral vascular diseases by a doppler ultrasound.Rule out diabetes and take vitamin B12 supplements and regularly do some ankle exercises.Wear appropriate footwear and if you do not get releif from your symptoms you would need to follow up with an orthopedician.Take care!

question: Whenever I sit or lay down for periods of time, when I get up I experience a numbness in my foot. It has a tingly feeling and feels like it is asleep. This feeling lasts for about a minute or two. Could this be a problem with poor circulation or a high blood pressure issue? High blood pressure, stroke, and heart attacks have been a factor in my family.. My blood pressure has however been kind of low lately.
title: Numbness in feet
